childnodes.sy: Where’s a true biscuit lover to go? The answer is pretty obvious. Whether you top it with a classic burger or fried chicken with sausage gravy, a flaky, buttery biscuit from Biscuit Love is sure to make you swoon.

Top Chef winner Richard Blais has opened a burger boutique in Nashville, and the food lives up to the hype. Do NOT miss out on the fries – they’re cooked in beef fat and the whole process takes 2 days…but they’ll probably all be gone in 2 minutes.

Come to Indian-inspired gastropub Chauhan Ale & Masala House and order the deliciously battered fish and chips with a carrot halwa whoopie pie for dessert. If you love to dance, check their Facebook page for info on Bollywood dance nights.

The menu at Sinema is overseen by a “Top Chef” alum, so it’s going to change a lot, but be sure to get the stroganoff and the “surf, surf and surf” if you can. Dinner is amazing, but the Sunday brunch (with no reservations needed) is great too.

Combining a classy atmosphere with slap-yo-mama good food, Prima offers a one-of-a-kind dining experience in Nashville. The dynamic duo of lobster gnocchi and braised short ribs with a side of crispy sweet potatoes is a good place to start.

Barista Parlor is oozing with ambience and serves great food, to boot – don’t miss out on the speedy biscuit with ham and maple syrup and the oatmeal topped with apple butter. But the main event here is still the coffee – they’ve got it all.

The Sutler Saloon’s all-new menu includes can’t-miss gems like honey and bacon popcorn, Yukon gold potatoes with crème fraiche, and fried shallots with cheddar cheese. Check out Bluegrass Sundays & the cool event space downstairs.

Whether it’s date night, friend night, or any night, prepare to get your mind blown by the amazingly prepared food at The 404 Kitchen. Must-order items include the black truffle burrata, dry aged beef tartar and, most importantly, the lamb sugo.
